alert.note: Alert for Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 6:58AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern El Paso County through 730 AM MDT... At 657 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Schriever AFB, or 18 miles southeast of Colorado Springs, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Very heavy rain, winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Fountain around 715 AM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Security, Security-Widefield, Peterson AFB, Cimarron Hills, Stratmoor and Fort Carson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft
